Initially, two faint figures are observed in the distance, appearing to be in the middle of the road. As the vehicle approaches, these figures are clearly identified as two pedestrians walking across the road from the right side towards the left, directly into the vehicle's path. The pedestrians become an immediate and unavoidable hazard due to their position and the vehicle's closing speed. A collision occurs with one of the pedestrians, who is subsequently seen lying on the ground on the right side of the vehicle.
